article: Many adults see teens as energetic. Many of us see ourselves as proud. This thinking _ many adults and us, too, to have the idea that if we can't handle school or _ life well, we're just not trying. But in my opinion that may not be _ . Earlier this school year, I was leaving my class one Friday, when suddenly it _ like I had pulled a muscle in my back. I knew I was ill. After a few days I stopped eating. This meant I lost _ ; the clothes that I bought two weeks earlier began _ loose. This time my parents got scared. In addition , I started sleeping less. My eyelids were constantly _ . I refused to _ that I was i11.I kept my job working 25 hours a week in a shop; I didn't _ any classes. When I was hurting, I didn't mind and kept on going. _ it kills you, it makes you stronger, right? But now I find myself thinking. Is it worth it? I'm taking the classes and writing for the newspaper because it looks good _ college applications. And I' m working 25 hours a week so that, once I get into my dream school, I can _ it. Here I am, already sick from the _ of work I'm doing in and out of school. So, what good is an impressive application if I'm badly ill? What is the _ of doing this work if I can't enjoy the results? In fact, by writing my _ I'm telling all the people who _ much about the future to worry about it now. This is my warning: Don't climb the _ dive if you don't like the deep end.
